description.narrative: GGF grant will be used to raise public awareness and help solve the water contamination problem resulting from flushing the waste from piggeries. Pigs are highly valued as a symbol of honor and respect in Pohnpei, thus most households have small facilities to raise pigs. Waste management system is not well established and pen clean out involves the flushing of waste on the ground or nearby water sources; estimated 92,300 gallons of polluted wastewater is discharged per piggery operation. Pohnpei Environmental Protection Agency discovered that 68% of the major streams on Pohnpei are unsafe for recreational use and drinking due to excessive amount of E. Coli bacteria. Pohnpei Women's Advisory Council (PWAC) will launch advocacy and public awareness campaign in support of the Dry Litter Technology (DLT) for managing piggery waste. DLT uses wood chips and other materials to absorb the waste and process it into compost later. PWAC will design advocacy materials and hold planning sessions and meetings with state leaders and senators. The group will hold meeting and awareness raising activities with piggery owners, village chiefs, nonprofit partners, and representatives from women and youth groups.
